items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire

items.message:
Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. A drier outlook is forecast over the coming days with a few isolated showers on Saturday.
We recommend that you avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses as there may still be standing water in some locations.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. 
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses

The risk of flooding from the River Rase has now reduced and levels have fallen below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

River levels are now steadily falling, but still remain quite high in some locations. The forecast is for no further rainfall for the next few days. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Flood water is dangerous. Don't put yourself or others at risk. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: Isolated low lying properties along the tidal River Waveney
items.message: River levels are now steadily falling, but still remain quite high in some locations. A Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area. The forecast is for no further rainfall for the next few days. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: Riverside properties along the tidal River Yare including Cantley, Brundall and Reedham
items.message: Flooding is expected in this area. This means properties are at risk of flooding. Please take action to protect yourself and your property and monitor local weather and river conditions. Avoid contact with, walking or driving through flood water. Consider activating any property flood protection products you may have.  Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.
